unit_learning_outcomes.description: Analyse source material, including archaeological records, ancient sources, and modern scholarship
Demonstrate critical thinking in reading of the literature and interpretation of the data
Identify fundamental developments, theories and techniques of archaeology
Acquire knowledge of the archaeological discipline
Communicate archaeological information and concepts through oral, visual and written formats

assessments.description: 10 short, weekly questions related to content covered in lectures and tutorials.
Write a short encyclopedia entry (approximately 200 words)
Describe, analyse and document an artefact
A two-hour examination on all course content

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: AHIS1300 - Digging up the Past: An Introduction to Archaeology
data.description: This unit serves as a broad introduction to archaeology, where students become familiar with its fundamental principles and concepts. Students will study the emergence of archaeology as a discipline, its purpose and aims. This unit will provide students with a foundation in the various methods and analytical techniques used to study archaeological evidence by using a combination of theory and practical case studies drawn from all periods of archaeology. Students will explore the various ways of interpreting archaeological remains, taking into account the multidisciplinary nature of the discipline.
data.search_title: AHIS1300 - Digging up the Past: An Introduction to Archaeology

title: Digging up the Past: An Introduction to Archaeology
